title: Effects of Calorie Restriction / Intermittent Fasting on Longevity and Aging Biomarkers in Adults
description: Systematic search protocol for studies investigating calorie restriction or intermittent fasting and their associations with lifespan, healthspan, and biomarkers of aging in adult humans.

pico.population: Adults aged 50 years and older (human studies)
pico.intervention: Calorie restriction or intermittent fasting (time-restricted feeding, alternate-day fasting, periodic fasting)
pico.comparison: Usual diet or ad libitum intake (or alternative dietary regimens)
outcomes: Biomarkers of aging (telomere length, epigenetic clocks, inflammatory markers, metabolic markers)
Incidence of age-related disease (cardiovascular disease, neurodegeneration, cancer)

scope_and_limits.population_notes: Primarily human studies. Animal studies may be collected separately if specified in future iterations.

inclusion_criteria: Original research articles (randomized controlled trials, non-randomized trials, cohort studies, case-control studies, cross-sectional studies)
Human participants with mean or median age >= 50 or subgroup analyses reporting results for >=50
Studies reporting at least one predefined outcome
Full text available (open access or accessible via institutional subscription) — if full text unavailable, include metadata/abstract
exclusion_criteria: Animal-only studies (unless flagged for separate animal review)
Narrative reviews, opinion pieces, editorials (but systematic reviews may be harvested for references)
Case reports or small case series (n < 5) unless reporting unique mechanistic endpoints
Non-English publications (unless translation feasible in later stage)

search_parameters.boolean_logic: use AND/OR/NOT as appropriate; group synonyms with OR, combine concepts with AND

example_search_strings.pubmed_simple: ("calorie restriction"[Title/Abstract] OR "caloric restriction"[Title/Abstract] OR "intermittent fasting"[Title/Abstract] OR "time restricted feeding"[Title/Abstract] OR "alternate day fasting"[Title/Abstract]) AND (aging[Title/Abstract] OR ageing[Title/Abstract] OR longevity[Title/Abstract] OR lifespan[Title/Abstract]) AND (humans[MeSH Terms] OR humans[Title/Abstract])
example_search_strings.pubmed_with_mesh: (("Caloric Restriction"[MeSH] OR "Fasting"[MeSH]) OR ("calorie restriction"[Title/Abstract] OR "intermittent fasting"[Title/Abstract])) AND ("Aging"[MeSH] OR "Longevity"[MeSH] OR aging[Title/Abstract]) AND ("Aged"[MeSH] OR "Aged, 80 and over"[MeSH] OR adult[Title/Abstract])
example_search_strings.pmc_oai_example: Use PMID list returned by PubMed search to check for PMCID via ELink and then fetch full-text from PMC OAI-PMH if PMCID exists.

query_template.combine_rules: Group synonyms with OR inside parentheses, then combine concept blocks with AND. Example block structure: (population_terms) AND (intervention_terms) AND (outcome_terms). Apply MeSH mapping where available.
query_template.final_example: (("older adult" OR elderly OR aged) AND ("calorie restriction" OR "intermittent fasting" OR "time restricted feeding") AND (longevity OR lifespan OR "biomarker" OR telomere OR "epigenetic clock"))

workflow_notes.step_1: Use Entrez ESearch on PubMed with the 'pubmed_with_mesh' string or programmatically construct queries from the keywords/mesh arrays.
workflow_notes.step_2: Retrieve PMIDs; use ESummary/Efetch to obtain metadata and abstracts.
workflow_notes.step_3: For each PMID, call ELink to find matching PMCIDs (linkname=pubmed_pmc). If PMCID present, fetch full text via PMC OAI-PMH or the PMC article landing page.
workflow_notes.step_4: Aggregate records from all databases, normalize fields, remove duplicates based on DOI/PMID/title.
workflow_notes.step_5: Export final library to TXT and BibTeX/RIS files; download available PDFs into a 'fulltext' subfolder.

notes_for_developers: This protocol is intentionally conservative (English-only, 2000-present). Adjust date range, languages, and inclusion criteria as needed. retmax_per_db can be increased when running full harvests; consider using API key rate limits and NCBI request policies.
